title: Full-strength Wales desperate to postpone Warren Gatland's farewell in quarter-final
text:
Every Wales player at the World Cup – save captain Alun Wyn Jones – has Warren Gatland to thank for being given a Test cap and a sense of doing their head coach proud is fuelling the camp in the build-up to their quarter-final with France on Sunday.

After 11 trophy-laden years in charge Gatland will depart Wales at the end of the Japan tournament and there is a very real chance the Oita match against Les Bleus could be his last game.

The 56-year-old plans on that not being the case and taking his team all the way to the Nov 2 final and the men around him believe that in Gatland, they have the secret to success. “Warren has been around for a long time,” said Wales flanker Josh Navidi.

“He’s...
description: Every Wales player at the World Cup – save captain Alun Wyn Jones – has Warren Gatland to thank for being given a Test cap and a sense of doing their head coach proud is fuelling the camp in the build-up to their quarter-final with France on Sunday.
